headline.main: Hassan II of Morocco Dies at 70; A Monarch Oriented to the West

abstract: King Hassan II, who ruled Morocco for 38 years, acted as go-between in Egyptian-Israeli efforts to make peace and prolonged life of his 300-year-old dynasty in an era when monarchies in Libya, Egypt, Iraq and Iran fell to socialist revolutions or forces of militant Islam, dies in Rabat at age 70; Crown Prince Sidi Mohammed, King's eldest son and succesor, is expected to continue his father's policies, including close ties with US and active pursuit of peace in Middle East; Pres Clinton will attend funeral; photo; map (M)
